Fault Management

The PW EMS user interface (UI) uses fault management to manage and view active alarms and events raised by the SON components, HNG, and vBBU, and view their history.

The system displays events and alarms in a history table so that events or alarms can be viewed for a point in time. A user with administrative privileges can clear the alarms and events history from the SON and HNG databases. The system also removes all alarms and associated events if a node, such as the vBBU, is removed from the system or restarted. Any active alarms are kept in the system database indefinitely until the alarms are cleared.

  • Manage Alarms
  • Manage Events
    A generated event represents information about an action or state related to a device. Sometimes an event can pertain to the PW EMS itself. Most generated events contain configuration, connectivity, and state change information. Events can also provide information about alarm conditions, warnings, or errors that occur on devices.
Parent topic: System Management
